1.text: Better a poor man who walks with integrity than a fool whose lips are perverse.

2.text: Even zeal is no good without knowledge, and he who hurries his footsteps misses the mark.

3.text: A man’s own folly subverts his way, yet his heart rages against the LORD.

4.text: Wealth attracts many friends, but a poor man is deserted by his friend.

5.text: A false witness will not go unpunished, and one who utters lies will not escape.

6.text: Many seek the favor of the prince, and everyone is a friend of the gift giver.

7.text: All the brothers of a poor man hate him—how much more do his friends avoid him! He may pursue them with pleading, but they are nowhere to be found.

8.text: He who acquires wisdom loves himself; one who safeguards understanding will find success.

9.text: A false witness will not go unpunished, and one who pours out lies will perish.

10.text: Luxury is unseemly for a fool—how much worse for a slave to rule over princes!

11.text: A man’s insight gives him patience, and his virtue is to overlook an offense.

12.text: A king’s rage is like the roar of a lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass.

13.text: A foolish son is his father’s ruin, and a quarrelsome wife is like a constant dripping.

14.text: Houses and wealth are inherited from fathers, but a prudent wife is from the LORD.

15.text: Laziness brings on deep sleep, and an idle soul will suffer hunger.

16.text: He who keeps a commandment preserves his soul, but he who is careless in his ways will die.

17.text: Kindness to the poor is a loan to the LORD, and He will repay the lender.

18.text: Discipline your son, for in that there is hope; do not be party to his death.

19.text: A man of great anger must pay the penalty; if you rescue him, you will have to do so again.

20.text: Listen to counsel and accept discipline, that you may be wise the rest of your days.

21.text: Many plans are in a man’s heart, but the purpose of the LORD will prevail.

22.text: The desire of a man is loving devotion; better to be poor than a liar.

23.text: The fear of the LORD leads to life, that one may rest content, without visitation from harm.

24.text: The slacker buries his hand in the dish; he will not even bring it back to his mouth.

25.text: Strike a mocker, and the simple will beware; rebuke the discerning man, and he will gain knowledge.

26.text: He who assaults his father or evicts his mother is a son who brings shame and disgrace.

27.text: If you cease to hear instruction, my son, you will stray from the words of knowledge.

28.text: A corrupt witness mocks justice, and a wicked mouth swallows iniquity.

29.text: Judgments are prepared for mockers, and beatings for the backs of fools.
